head.supplied: Melbourne, ¶ 27 Aug. 1886. ¶ The honorable Alfr. Deakin, M.L.A., ¶ Chief Secretary. ¶ Sir...

div.p: P86/2759, unit 145, VPRS 1163/P1 inward correspondence files, VA 672 Premier's Office, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to submit herewith a list of 100 Institutions or Men of science, who would have fair claim to receive from the Government a copy of the quarto-volume of Myoporinous plants,
B86.08.05. recently issued at the Gov. Printing Office, in exchange for litterary contributions received from them. I therefore beg to solicit, that should my proposition meet with the approval of the Government, this sending may be effected through the public Library.
I have the honor to be, Sir, your obedient servant

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Ferd. von Mueller.
The list that follows is in the hand of Georg Luehmann.
On 31 August 1886, the Undersecretary, T. Wilson, asked M to send a copy of the work for the information of the Chief Secretary. M replied: 'Copy now forwarded by post. 2/9/86'. However, Wilson replied saying that he has sent only vol. II and requested 'a copy of the work complete, or so far as completed'. M replied, 8 September: 'Vol. II is quite complete in itself. Vol. I gives the full separata text; but can only appear in 1887, as the work "Key to the system of Victorian plants" must receive precedence for completion'. M was informed on 9 September 1886 that his request had been approved and the next day he returned the file 'with best thanks'. On 15 September the Government Printer was instructed to provide the required number of copies and the Librarian, Public Library, was instructed to send them to the institutions and people on M's list. The file was returned to the Premier's Office on 12 October 1886. Copies were despatched from the Public Library on 19 October to the people and institutions on M’s list; see Unit10, pp. 433-9, VPRS 802/, Librarian's outward registered correspondence, 1864-1957, VA 913 Public Library of Victoria, Public Record Office, Victoria.
